ProjectInfo.Title: E-Commerce Customer & Sales Analysis Using Apache Spark

Submission.Abstract: This project analyzes an e-commerce dataset using Apache Spark (PySpark) to extract valuable insights such as total revenue, best-selling products, top customers, sales by country, and average basket value. Spark was used due to its high performance and ability to process large datasets efficiently.

Dataset.Description: The dataset contains transaction records from an online retail store with the following columns: InvoiceNo, StockCode, Description, Quantity, InvoiceDate, UnitPrice, CustomerID, and Country.
Dataset.RecordsNote: Enter number of records after loading the dataset

Preprocessing.Step: Removed rows with missing critical values.
Filtered out records with non-positive Quantity or UnitPrice.
Created a new column TotalPrice = Quantity * UnitPrice.

Script.Purpose: Performs data cleaning, total revenue calculation, best-selling product analysis, top customer identification, country-level sales analysis, average invoice value calculation, and monthly sales reporting.

ExecutionSteps.Step: Place online_retail.csv and ecommerce_analysis.py in the same directory.
Open a terminal or command prompt in that directory.
Wait for Spark to finish processing.
Check the generated folder ecommerce_results for output files.
Attach the result files and screenshots (if required) with the submission.

NotesForInstructor.Note: This project was implemented as an educational example using a small dataset.
The same script can be used for larger datasets without code modification.
